page.title: 02Maplesteads' Inland Water
page.content: We found ninety ponds in the Essex boulder clay.Eight ponds were dipped and flora and fauna recorded:- {Insects_}Common blue damsel fly,Water Scorpion,Whirligig,Pond skater,Water boatmen,Mosquito larva,Hover fly, Mayfly larva, Water fleas,Shrimp. {Fish-} Stickleback,Minnow.{ {Birds-}Moorhen,Mallard ducks. {Amphibians-}One Newt,no frogs. {Flora-}Farm ponds had little plant life except for algae and duckweed due to use of herbicides and fertilisers. Those ponds supplied by natural springs provided conditions for plant life - Bullrushes,Frogbit,Bistort, Yellow Flag.Ponds have lost their agricultural function and are at risk of neglect and loss of wildlife.Uses today:boating,fishing,keeping water fowl,providing water for spraying.
